results.title: Metformin Prevents Renal Stone Formation through an Antioxidant Mechanism In Vitro and In Vivo
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ suppressed @<m>DISEASE_Crystal_Arthropathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000070657 @@@urinary crystal deposit@@@ formation through renal tubular cell protection and antioxidative effects.

citations.NLM: Yang X, Ding H, Qin Z, Zhang C, Qi S, Zhang H, Yang T, He Z, Yang K, Du E, Liu C, Xu Y, Zhang Z. Metformin Prevents Renal Stone Formation through an Antioxidant Mechanism In Vitro and In Vivo Oxid Med Cell Longev. 2016;2016():4156075. PMID: 27781075

results.title: Metformin prevents nephrolithiasis formation by inhibiting the expression of OPN and MCP-1 in vitro and in vivo
results.text_hl: Therefore, the results of the study suggest that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ suppressed urinary @<m>DISEASE_Crystal_Arthropathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000070657 @@@crystal deposit@@@ formation, possibly by mediating the expression of @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ mediators @GENE_SPP1 @GENE_478471 @@@OPN@@@ and MCP-1.

citations.NLM: Yang X, Yang T, Li J, Yang R, Qi S, Zhao Y, Li L, Li J, Zhang X, Yang K, Xu Y, Liu C. Metformin prevents nephrolithiasis formation by inhibiting the expression of OPN and MCP-1 in vitro and in vivo Int J Mol Med. 2019 Apr;43(4):1611-1622. PMID: 30720053
